key_risks: Driver shortages impacting operations and increasing labor costs
Regulatory and legal pressures, including environmental compliance and legal disputes
Economic sensitivity tied to freight volumes and profitability
controversies: $57 million legal settlement over a contract dispute related to the acquisition of Watkins & Shepard
Wage and hour lawsuits, including a $20.5 million settlement in California
Revived misclassification lawsuit involving truck driver Eric Brant
environmental_issues: Evolving emissions and safety regulations increasing operational costs
social_issues: Labor disputes and wage issues, including misclassification lawsuits
Challenges in recruiting and retaining qualified drivers
governance_issues: Legal liabilities and financial impact from ongoing litigation

sources.title: Schneider National to Pay $28 Million to Settle Suit
sources.snippet: Schneider National Carriers Inc. will pay $28 million to settle a class-action lawsuit by California truck drivers who claim the company shorted them on pay.The resolution of the case, which dates to 2008, marks the second time in two and a half years that Schneider has agreed to a multimillion-dollar class-action settlement after workers alleged they were underpaid.
